title: FCC Asks Record Labels to Document Anti-Payola Policies
summary: Commissioner O'Rielly cites recent reports of practices that would violate laws. title: The 'Corrupt Purposes' Impeachment
summary: Why the House logic is a danger to all future Presidents.. As House managers make their impeachment case, many Americans will dismiss it all as a partisan effort that hasn't persuaded the country and will die in the Senate. They have a point. But the precedents that Democrats are setting could live on, so forgive us if we explain how dangerous the House's impeachment logic is to future Presidents and the Constitution's separation of powers.

title: Quarantined in Wuhan
summary: China cuts off travel to the city where a new virus emerged.. The Chinese government on Wednesday cut train and air travel out of the city of Wuhan in a race to contain the mysterious coronavirus that has sickened more than 500 on the mainland. Quarantining a city of 11 million is a radical step, the kind democracies are loath to take, but then maybe China is determined not to relive the deadly SARS outbreak of 2003 and be blamed for a global pandemic.

title: Warren's Banana Republic
summary: She promises to investigate Trump officials after she wins.. Think the fog of partisan Trump investigations will lift once the President leaves office, either in 2021 or 2025? Not if Elizabeth Warren has anything to say about it. With the Iowa caucuses approaching and her campaign fortunes flagging, Senator Warren now says that as President she'd launch an open-ended criminal investigation into her predecessor and anyone who worked for him.

title: Kansas, Kansas State Players Suspended After Brawl

title: Former Grammy Chief Denies Rape Allegation Aired by Successor

title: 'The Shenzhen Experiment' Review: Building Up a 'Fishing Village'
summary: The overlooked history of Shenzhen doesn't necessarily ﬁt the government's myth of a well-planned "instant city.". For more than half a year, headlines have been crowded with reports of popular protests and police repression taking place in the most famous city in China's Pearl River Delta, the former British colony of Hong Kong. For even longer, Western journalists have chronicled the area's staggeringly ambitious local infrastructure projects, from impressive new high-speed rail lines to a bridge of record-setting length that runs from Hong Kong to the former Portuguese colony of Macau and from that casino-filled island to the city of Zhuhai in Guangdong Province.

title: Time to Stop the 'Doomsday Clock'
summary: 'Atomic scientists' have no special authority when they opine on politics or military strategy.. The Bulletin of the Atomic Scientists is resetting its "Doomsday Clock," which has stood still since 2018 at two minutes to midnight. I was a member of the Bulletin's Board of Sponsors for a dozen years and chaired it from 2009 through 2018, and I think it's time to retire the clock.

title: Jimmy Carter's Persian Gulf Success
summary: His doctrine, outlined 40 years ago, doesn't get enough credit.. Jimmy Carter deserves a bit of the credit for the killing of Iranian Maj. Gen. Qasem Soleimani. summary: The profile in courage he describes in the Johnson Senate trial was no such thing.. title: All Is Not Well Today for Low-Wage Workers
summary: You gloss over the real economic hardship by focusing only on growth rates without also considering actual wage levels.. You gloss over the real economic hardship by focusing only on growth rates without also considering actual wage levels.

title: Despite the GAO, Mr. Trump Broke No Rule
summary: The balanced framework of the Impoundment Control Act belies any conclusion that, with respect to federal budget rules, the president's move to temporarily defer sending taxpayer dollars to Ukraine violates any legal rule.. Your editorial "Trump, Obama and the Spending Power" (Jan. 18) criticizing the GAO's opinion on Ukraine funding is correct. The GAO's conclusions that the Office of Management and Budget violated the law are misleading at best. The Impoundment Control Act recognizes the authority of the president to defer congressional spending, but directs the president to report such a deferral to Congress (2 USC §685) and give the reasons for it. Deferrals are permitted if they are consistent with legislative policy and authorized by law (2 USC §684). The act recognizes that a president (for whatever reasons) might fail to send the required message to Congress (2 USC §686) and contains a specific remedy for such a reporting omission by the executive. The remedy is that the GAO comptroller general "shall" make a report to Congress about the deferral (2 USC §686). The act also authorizes the comptroller general to bring a civil suit to require that the deferred funds be spent (2 USC §686).

title: Frieda Caplan, 'Queen of Kiwi,' Enlivened American Cuisine
summary: Fearless fruit and vegetable wholesaler promoted jicama and gave David Letterman's palate a shock. Starting with a tiny Los Angeles-based wholesale fruit and vegetable business in 1962, Frieda Caplan helped make the American palate more adventurous by promoting kiwi fruit.

title: Sen. Booker Is No Spartacus
summary: While preparing to run for president in 2020 he knew he needed the large portion of campaign funding that comes from teachers unions, so he did an about-face.. Regarding Marcus A. Winters's "Cory Booker Goes Down Fighting" (op-ed, Jan. 15): Mr. Winters says, Sen. Booker "refused to be bullied when it comes to charter schools" and that the former Newark, N.J., mayor refused to bow to teachers unions. It is true that he gave impassioned speeches in favor of charter schools, but there is a difference between his rhetoric and his actions when it comes to politics. He voted "no" on the nomination of Betsy DeVos for secretary of education though she is a strong advocate for charter schools and school vouchers. At the time that he was preparing to run for president in 2020 he knew he needed the large portion of campaign funding that comes from teachers unions, so he did an about-face. In this case Sen. Booker, unlike Spartacus, wasn't willing to sacrifice himself for a cause he believes in.

title: Are Elite Golf Courses Worth the Steep Fees?
summary: A few U.S. courses cater to seriously deep pockets, charging up to $550 for 18 holes. A premium experience-or just a waste of time and money? We argue both sides. THE GOLF BUSINESS is not so busy lately. After decades of expansion, courses have been closing faster than new ones open. "Grow the game" has long been the industry mantra. Good luck with that-Fortnite maybe, but golf? Not so much. The good news is that the grand game survives and can be played for a reasonable cost at innumerable municipal and "daily fee" courses. But the kind of golf made for bragging rights and tax write-offs alike has become increasingly inaccessible as the greens fees at elite courses have skyrocketed.

title: Australia's Fragile Blue Mountains, Before the Blaze and Now
summary: Novelist Tishani Doshi on the 'ecotastrophy' threatening the wildlife and prehistoric landscape of Australia's Blue Mountains. I CAN'T STOP LOOKING at images of Australia's bush fires. One composite 3-D visualization created using NASA satellite data makes the country look like a charred lung turned sideways, a gash of a continent ablaze. A friend writes to say they are going through an "ecotastrophy"-early estimates of over a billion animals dead, more than 27,000 square miles of scorched land, and apocalyptic red skies that have drifted over to New Zealand. Another friend tells me about how she goes to sit in the fire ground to connect with what's left. The other day she heard black cockatoos perched in burned-out trees make a sound she could only interpret as screaming.

title: Nassar Victims Move to Throw Out USA Gymnastics' Bankruptcy Bid
summary: The gymnasts and the federation remain far apart in mediation to resolve legal claims stemming from decades of sexual abuse. Victims of longtime national team physician Larry Nassar moved to dismiss USA Gymnastics' bankruptcy proceedings Tuesday, a sign that the gymnasts and federation remain far apart in mediation talks to resolve legal claims stemming from sexual abuse by Nassar over a three-decade period.

title: Options Markets Brace for Election Volatility
summary: S&P 500 volatility tends to especially pick up in October and November ahead of the election, Credit Suisse says. Options markets are bracing for big swings in stock prices around the U.S. presidential election.

title: The Astros Cheated. Baseball Wanted Answers. So It Made a Deal.
summary: MLB struck an agreement with the MLBPA early in the investigation granting immunity for honest testimony. In a scathing investigatory report released last week, Major League Baseball commissioner Rob Manfred repeatedly refers to the Houston Astros' sign-stealing scheme in 2017 and 2018 as "player-driven." Yet Manfred also declared: "I will not assess discipline against individual Astros players."

title: The Best Seats Airlines Hold Back From Frequent Fliers
summary: U.S. airlines have gotten particularly stingy in offering international business- and first-class seats for the lowest available number of points or miles. The top dream in frequent-flier awards has become an illusion at U.S. airlines.

title: As Virus Spreads, Isolated Taiwan Risks Being a Loophole in War on Epidemics
summary: Chinese efforts to exclude Taipei from WHO hamper global response to health crises, officials and experts say. Taiwan's first reported case of a patient infected by a deadly coronavirus spreading across Asia turns a spotlight on Beijing's attempts to exclude the self-governing island from the World Health Organization, which Taiwanese officials say hinders an effective global response to public-health crises.

title: Money Managers Venture Into Risky World of Trade Finance
summary: Trade finance has historically been dominated by banks-but some powerhouses are dialing back.

title: The Dark Business of Coronavirus
summary: A mobile game called Plague Inc. becomes the top paid app in China's version of Apple's App Store. The link between viruses, viral news stories and business is inevitably an uncomfortable one. It gets darker still when the business is a game in which players spread a virtual disease.

title: Johns Hopkins University Reimagines the M.B.A.
summary: The Baltimore business school is threading health-care courses throughout its program, refocusing on quant skills. Johns Hopkins University is blowing up its business-school curriculum.

title: CBS Bets Big on 'Star Trek: Picard' to Boost Streaming
summary: ViacomCBS's All Access is riding the Starship Enterprise to distinguish itself in a crowded field. As the overseer of the "Star Trek" television properties for Viacom CBS Inc., producer Alex Kurtzman is charged with updating the space drama for a new generation without alienating its hard-core fans.

title: Stocks to Watch: Tesla, Apple, General Motors, Netflix, Johnson & Johnson
summary: Here are some of the companies with shares expected to trade actively Wednesday. Here are some of the companies with shares expected to trade actively in Wednesday's session. Stock movements noted by ticker reflect movements during regular trading hours; premarket trading is specified separately.

title: For Senators at Impeachment Trial, No Coffee, No Cellphones and No Talking
summary: Democratic and Republican lawmakers buckle down for contentious days and long nights ahead. The impeachment trial of President Trump exchanged the ceremony of last week's opening session for a bruising battle over rules on Tuesday, as a somber Capitol Hill adjusted to new restrictions on lawmakers and the press-and buckled down for contentious days and long nights ahead.

title: After Marathon Session, Senate Passes Trump Impeachment Trial Rules
summary: Vote, along party lines, pushed off question of whether to call witnesses, allow new evidence. WASHINGTON-Senators approved rules early Wednesday morning for the third presidential impeachment trial in U.S. history, after President Trump's legal team clashed with Democrats over their allegations of abuse of power and obstruction of Congress.

title: GM's Cruise Reveals New Robot Taxi: Toaster-Shaped, No Steering Wheel
summary: U.S. automobile giant plans to unveil production details soon for its on-demand ride-hailing car. SAN FRANCISCO- General Motors Co. 's autonomous car unit, Cruise, revealed a toaster-shaped robot taxi that it says will be cheaper than taking a human-driven ride-hailing service or driving a car.

title: Hong Kong Protest Organizer Faces Incitement Charge
summary: Ventus Lau, who has organized several large protests over the past few months, could be jailed for up to six years, according to his lawyer. A leading organizer of the pro-democracy protests in Hong Kong appeared in court Tuesday, accused of defying police orders to disband a rally, in what activists say is an effort by city authorities to weaken the opposition movement by deterring others from staging demonstrations.

title: This Technique Takes a Recipe From Ordinary to Electrifying
summary: Tarka, the Indian method of infusing oil with spices and aromatics, brings warmth and vitality to a comforting bowl of lentils. AT AGE 9 Cheetie Kumar made her first dal, the Indian staple of stewed lentils. "It was a rite of passage," she said. At 13, she mastered frying spices and aromatics such as onions, ginger and garlic in oil-a technique known as tarka-to unlock fat-soluble flavor compounds. Today Ms. Kumar uses tarka in a number of dishes at her restaurant Garland in Raleigh, N.C. "I rely on it for vibrancy," she said. Stirred into a mellow dal, the flavorful oil is like a bolt of lightning.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Bezos' Phone Was Likely Hacked by Chat Account Linked to Saudi Prince, Audit Finds
summary: Phone allegedly began leaking data shortly after being sent a video file from WhatsApp account linked to Prince Mohammed. WASHINGTON-Cybersecurity experts hired by Amazon.com Inc. founder Jeff Bezos have alleged that his phone was probably hacked in 2018 by a WhatsApp account associated with Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, according to a person familiar with the matter.

title: Recipe for a Cake Seriously Worth the Splurge
summary: Sauternes is a wine made for special occasions. Baked into a cake it's doubly extravagant, and the recipe is otherwise surprisingly simple. I KNOW THE HOLIDAYS are over. But occasions to celebrate arise in every month of the year. When they do, I recommend adopting this French festive custom: Serve a cake infused with sweet, rich Sauternes, a wine that reliably telegraphs opulence and indulgence.

title: Derek Jeter, Larry Walker Are Elected Into Baseball's Hall of Fame
summary: The former Yankees shortstop appeared on 396 of the 397 ballots cast by the Baseball Writers' Association of America. Derek Jeter was elected into the Hall of Fame on Tuesday night, and it's clear what will come next: well-intentioned people offering breathless odes to how the longtime New York Yankees shortstop elevated his performance in the postseason. This is the narrative that earned him the nickname of "Captain Clutch" and solidified his place not just as a great player, but as an all-time legend.

title: Mitsubishi Offices in Germany Raided in Diesel-Emissions Fraud Probe
summary: Raids across three German states seek evidence models may be equipped with test-cheating software. BERLIN-German authorities raided facilities connected to the German subsidiary of Mitsubishi Motors Corp. as part of a probe into allegations that the Japanese auto maker installed illegal emissions-management software on some diesel-powered vehicles sold in Germany.

title: South Korea's First Transgender Soldier Might Get Thrown Out of the Military
summary: After sex-reassignment surgery in Thailand, the anonymous soldier has found herself a test case for the role of LGBT people in South Korea. SEOUL-A South Korean transgender soldier faces a potential discharge this week after undergoing gender-reassignment surgery late last year, in a test case for the role LGBT people play in the socially conservative country.

title: Xerox to Nominate as Many as 11 Directors to HP Board
summary: Xerox in recent weeks bought a small HP stake. Xerox Holdings Corp. is preparing to nominate as many as 11 directors to HP Inc.'s board, according to people familiar with matter, in an aggressive move to push a $33 billion unsolicited takeover bid for the maker of computers and printers.

title: Recording Academy CEO Files Discrimination Complaint Ahead of Grammy Awards
summary: Deborah Dugan says she was placed on leave in retaliation for raising concerns at body that bestows Grammys. The chief executive of the Recording Academy, who has been on leave involuntarily since last week, filed a discrimination complaint alleging that the group's general counsel sexually harassed her and that its board of directors improperly influences nominations for the Grammy Awards.

title: Argentine Governor Rattles Markets With Plans to Delay Bond Payment
summary: The far-left politician is raising fears that his faction of the ruling Peronist coalition could push the rest of the federal government into a messy new debt default. A far-left governor of Argentina's most populous province is rattling investors with plans to hold off paying back foreign debt, raising fears that his faction of the ruling Peronist coalition could push the rest of the federal government into a messy new debt default.

title: Netflix Subscriber Growth Falls Short in U.S., but Leaps Abroad
summary: Streaming firm faces rising competition in home market, and misses its October domestic forecast. Netflix Inc. missed its forecast for U.S. subscriber growth for the third straight quarter, but blew through its expectations for overseas expansion, a mixed performance that comes as the streaming giant faces heightened competition from a gaggle of rivals.

title: Psychologist Defends Interrogations of Sept. 11 Suspects
summary: At a pretrial hearing, James Mitchell says he was told CIA's methods, which many classify as torture, were legal; 'My sole focus was on stopping the next attack'. FORT MEADE, Md.-Attorneys for accused plotters of the Sept. 11, 2001, terrorist attacks sought to put the government on trial, calling to the stand a psychologist who helped design and execute harsh interrogations at secret Central Intelligence Agency facilities overseas.

title: SEC Decision on 4 p.m. Closing Trades Deals Blow to NYSE, Nasdaq
summary: Regulator approves Cboe end-of-day auction proposal despite opposition from two largest exchanges. Regulators have dealt a blow to the New York Stock Exchange and Nasdaq Inc. by loosening their grip on the 4 p.m. closing auctions that determine end-of-day prices for thousands of stocks.

title: Uber Is Testing a Feature That Lets Some Drivers Set Fares
summary: Move gives drivers more control in response to state's gig-economy law. SAN FRANCISCO- Uber Technologies Inc. is testing a new feature that allows some drivers in California to set their fares, the latest in a series of moves to give them more autonomy in response to the state's new gig-economy law.

title: Boeing Delays Expected MAX Return
summary: The new estimate for the FAA's signoff is expected in June or July. Boeing Co. on Tuesday pushed back its forecast for when regulators will clear the return of the 737 MAX to commercial service, saying it doesn't expect approval until midyear at the earliest.

title: 2020 Census Count Kicks Off in Alaska
summary: Lizzie Chimiugak, 90, was first Toksook Bay resident counted. The 2020 census started Tuesday in a remote Alaskan village where the Census Bureau's director personally enumerated one of the town's oldest residents.

title: Judicial Political Mischief
summary: A Codes of Conduct committee may bar judges from the Federalist Society.. The federal judiciary is a rare American institution these days that has maintained a reservoir of public trust. But that reputation will erode if the Committee on Codes of Conduct of the U.S. Judicial Conference follows through on its intention to ban judges from belonging to the Federalist Society.

title: Calling All Trial Witnesses
summary: We doubt Democrats want to hear from Hunter and Joe Biden.. The Senate impeachment trial began Tuesday with political theater over rules. Senate Republicans prefer an expeditious trial while Democrats who rushed to impeach in the House are suddenly demanding witnesses and crying "coverup." So let's break down what's really going on in the fight over witnesses.

title: Virginia Is for Gun Owners
summary: A peaceful protest shows wide support for the Second Amendment.. The Monday news from Virginia has been reported with almost palpable disappointment: More than 20,000 turned out in Richmond for their Second Amendment right to bear arms without violence. In the runup to the rally many, including Gov. Ralph Northam, pushed the idea that this was going to be another Charlottesville. But the gun owners even picked up their own trash.

title: IBM Earnings Hint at Signs of Turnaround
summary: Big Blue's fourth-quarter earnings boosted by Red Hat deal and mainframe computers. International Business Machines Corp. reported a slight increase in quarterly revenue, ending a streak of falling sales and providing a first indication Chief Executive Ginni Rometty's roughly $33 billion acquisition of open-source software giant Red Hat may help turn around Big Blue's fortunes.

title: Trump's Pyrrhic Trade Victories
summary: In search of easy wins, the U.S. is throwing away its best cards: fairness and the rule of law.. Historians will puzzle over this turn of events: A Republican U.S. president endorses central planning for trade, while a communist government in China cautions, in its trade deal with the U.S., that international commerce must reflect "market conditions." The American president boasts about raising import taxes on Americans and restricting immigration, while the Chinese lower trade barriers, encourage foreign investment and rely more on open-source software.

title: Bernie's 'Problems'
summary: There's a topic that Sen. Sanders doesn't want to discuss.. Clinging to a slim polling lead in New Hampshire three weeks before the first-in-the-nation primary, Sen. Bernie Sanders probably figured he could count on a friendly reception from the Granite State's government-backed broadcasters. And Vermont's most famous socialist certainly was treated to the soothing tones one expects from non-profit media. But there was nothing soft about the questions from New Hampshire Public Radio's Casey McDermott.

title: Why Obama Won and 2020's Black Candidates Couldn't
summary: He gave whites the benefit of the doubt. Booker and Harris took every chance to stoke racial grievances.. Shortly before President Obama left office, a black friend remarked to me over lunch that we might not see another black president elected for a very long time. He said white Americans had taken a chance on Mr. Obama and that he not only underperformed but racialized the presidency in ways that many voters didn't expect.

title: Are Fires a Climate Wake-Up Call?
summary: If so, activists will realize that pie-in-the-sky and extreme makeovers aren't a fix.. Whether climate change contributes 1% or 50% to Australia's wildfires, the fierce debate dramatizes the abyss of sterility into which activists have led climate politics. There is no climate policy (short of geoengineering to block a portion of sunlight reaching the earth) that would stop Australia's fires or prevent them from recurring.

title: Liberal Democracy's Threats From Within
summary: Illiberalism, ethnic nationalism and loss of confidence are bad news for freedom.. While the U.S. expends its energy fighting with itself, the rest of the world is on the move, and many of the trends are negative. To understand why liberal democracy is on the defensive, there is no better place to start than the 30th-anniversary edition of the Journal of Democracy, the flagship publication of the National Endowment for Democracy, which includes contributions from many of the world's leading experts. Here are some key insights:

title: 'American Queenmaker' Review: How She Earned Her Press Pass
summary: A newsroom pioneer who avoided the soft stories that ran in the women's pages and built a reputation as a trenchant political reporter.. Not long ago an article appeared about a brand of high heels that are all the rage among female journalists in Washington. A trivial topic, to be sure, but the story carried an underlying message about how the journalism business has welcomed women into its ranks in recent decades. There are so many of us now that a reporter deemed it newsworthy to write about our shoes.

title: Vale Ex-CEO, Others Charged With Homicide for Brazil Dam Collapse
summary: Charges also filed against other officials at mining company and at auditor TÜV SÜD. BRUMADINHO, Brazil-Brazilian prosecutors charged Vale SA's former CEO Fabio Schvartsman and 10 others from the mining company with homicide Tuesday for the deaths of 270 people in last year's collapse of its dam here.

title: Can a Woman Win in 2020?
summary: Students put aside what exactly Bernie Sanders said to Elizabeth Warren and answer the question.. Editor's note: This Future View is about the comment Elizabeth Warren claims Bernie Sanders made (and he denies), that a woman can't win the 2020 presidential election. For next week we'll ask, "What opinion do you hold that isn't shared by most of your peers?" Students should click here to submit opinions of fewer than 250 words before Jan. 28. The best responses will be published that night.

title: Waiting for a Moderate Democrat on Abortion
summary: Seven in 10 Americans, including 44% of Democrats, back restrictions after the first three months.. Hundreds of thousands of Americans will gather in Washington Friday for the 47th annual March for Life. Those who march come together to stand against abortion, the most significant human-rights abuse of the modern era. This cause unites people across party, color and faith. Yet many politicians throughout the U.S. are surprisingly out of step with what a majority of Americans-and in many cases a majority of Democrats-believe about abortion.

title: U.S. Plans to Expand Travel Restrictions to Seven Countries
summary: Nations being considered for new rules: Belarus, Eritrea, Kyrgyzstan, Myanmar, Nigeria, Sudan, Tanzania. WASHINGTON-The Trump administration plans to add seven countries to a group of nations subject to travel restrictions, including Nigeria, Africa's most populous country, along with others in Africa and Asia, according to administration officials who have seen the list.

title: Honoring the Heartland's Fallen Heroes
summary: An eternal flame burns in Indiana for officers killed in the line of duty.. Travel across Indiana by highway on a winter's day and you'll find no shortage of roadside attractions vying for your attention, many centered on sports.

title: The Second Amendment Sanctuary Movement Isn't Going Away
summary: The media smears them as 'white supremacists,' but thousands showed up in Richmond, Va., Monday.. Middletown, Va.
